title: Europe is about to launch one of its most ambitious missions ever
description: "We wanted to see if these were possible habitats for life."

title: Chemical reactions on the early Earth may have formed its ocean
description: Conditions that favor water may be common in the formation of rocky planets.

title: House Republican tries to protect Musk and Twitter from FTC investigation
description: Rep. Jim Jordan (R-Ohio) subpoenas FTC, claims it "harassed" Twitter and Musk.

title: DIY IBM Selectric type balls give ’60s typewriters new life (and Comic Sans)
description: A Selectric is nothing without a type ball, but finding one is a costly pain.

title: RIP HBO Max and Discovery+: “Max” launches May 23
description: It will offer more new Game of Thrones, Harry Potter, and Big Bang Theory shows.

title: Pang Pha, the Asian elephant, taught herself how to peel a banana
description: The elephant only peels yellow-brown bananas when alone, and can do so faster than humans.

title: Popular porn site must delete all amateur videos posted without consent
description: Amsterdam court requires porn sites to gain consent from all amateur performers.

title: Here’s the tech used to create a nearly 20-foot-tall Donkey Kong cabinet
description: The JAMMA adapters, superguns, and low-lag upscalers needed for Kong-scale Kong.

title: Elon Musk reportedly purchases thousands of GPUs for generative AI project at Twitter
description: Reports say it's a commitment to AI, despite signing cautionary AI "pause" letter.

title: NYPD Robocops: Hulking, 400-lb robots will start patrolling New York City
description: Mayor says new surveillance bots are "only the beginning" of police force revamp.

title: Eve Online player rigs in-game CEO vote to steal $22,000 of assets
description: Absentee corporate leadership failed to notice the vote before it was too late.

title: Meet PassGAN, the supposedly “terrifying” AI password cracker that’s mostly hype
description: AI cracking is on par with conventional methods, but you'd be forgiven for thinking otherwise.

title: Windows 11 beta changes what the Print Screen button does after 33 years
description: Key now opens the Snipping Tool by default rather than copying to the clipboard.

title: New EPA rules would cut car emissions 56% by 2032
description: New rules would affect light- and medium-duty vehicles.

title: NPR says goodbye to Elon Musk’s Twitter
description: NPR: Twitter is "falsely implying that we are not editorially independent."

title: What if the US followed Germany and shut down its nuclear plants?
description: There's a huge cost in lives from shutting off low-emission power plants.

title: Relativity Space is moving on from the Terran 1 rocket to something much bigger
description: Relativity Space is not going to launch again until at least 2026.

title: UMG tells Apple and Spotify to block AI lyric, melody scraping
description: Universal Music Group says new tech relies on unauthorized use of copyrighted material.

title: Nvidia’s $599 GeForce RTX 4070 is a more reasonably priced (and sized) Ada GPU
description: But it's the cheapest way (so far) to add DLSS 3 support to your gaming PC.

title: The mounting human and environmental costs of generative AI
description: Planetary impacts, escalating financial costs, and labor exploitation all factor.
